title: Add types - reduce bugs. Transition from Javascript to TypeScript.
descriptionInMd:
TypeScript is continuously gaining popularity and recognition in recent years, with Angular 2 using TypeScript being an important manifestation of the trend. Its advantages, such as static type checking and possibilities of better code structuring, have been appreciated by developers and proved to significantly reduce the amount of bugs.

During the workshop, we’ll introduce you to the dead-simple TypeScript syntax, show its main strong points working in practice and create a small AngularJS app.

Next, we’ll cover the main architectural challenges in AngularJS and show how TypeScript aids to overcome them. Last but not least, we’ll refactor an existing application (using external libraries) in order to gradually introduce types and use TypeScript capabilities to full extent.

All the details about our workshop and any necessary information you can find here: http://sollersconsulting.github.io/codepot/

tutors.name: Jakub Król
tutors.bio_in_md: Programista w zespole IT w Sollers Consulting. Zajmuje się tworzeniem aplikacji webowych dla rynku ubezpieczeń. Zwolennik pisania reużywalnego kodu front-endowego i wykorzystania zwinnych metodyk w wytwarzaniu oprogramowania.

tutors.name: Mateusz Chrzonstowski
tutors.bio_in_md: Starszy programista w zespole IT Sollers Consulting. Zajmuje się tworzeniem aplikacji webowych dla rynku ubezpieczeń. Entuzjasta frontendowych nowinek technologicznych, żywo zainteresowany Angularem i TypeScriptem.

title: O miękkiej części pracy scrum mastera...
descriptionInMd:
... czyli odrobina teorii, dużo przykładów i jeszcze więcej praktycznych pomysłów na rozwiązanie problemów w zespołach. W czasie kilku godzin pokażemy nasz warsztat scrum mastera i podzielimy się swoimi doświadczeniami z dwóch dużych organizacji. Dodatkowo będziemy się starali się pokazać każdy problem z różnych perspektyw – deweloperskiej, biznesowej i psychologicznej.

Zakres warsztatu:

Relacje w zespole –  o tym, co może być trudnego w rozwoju samego zespołu i jak sobie z tym radzić.

Kompetencje – jak stworzyć pętle informacji zwrotnej, pozwalające zespołowi się rozwijać. W tej części będzie dużo o testach i biznesie.

Autonomia zespołu czyli o takich ramach pracy w Scrumie, które dają zarówno wsparcie, jak i wolność nie niszcząc przy okazji przyjemności z pracy.

tutors.name: Agnieszka Biernacka
tutors.bio_in_md: Obecnie scrum master i agile coach w PZU. Poprzednio pracowała jako scrum master z zespołem mobilnym w PayU (Grupa Allegro). Łączy wykształcenie z zakresu psychologii społecznej z doświadczeniem technicznym. Ma na swoim koncie pracę w zespole scrumowym w software house oraz bogate doświadczenie trenerskie (m.in. jako trener Red Hat w Altkom Akademia) i projektowe. Pasjonatka zwinnych metodyk, naukowo zajmuje się motywacją w Agile.

tutors.name: Hubert Liberadzki
tutors.bio_in_md: Scrum Master/QA w PZU (dawniej Test Leader w LG Electronics). Tester oprogramowania z bogatą wiedzą techniczną. Zainteresowany zwinnymi metodykami wytwarzania oprogramowania.

title: Polymer and Firebase. Welcome to the future of web development.
descriptionInMd:
Polymer to największa rewolucja web developmetu od czasu pojawienia się HTML'a. Zmienia on sposób myślenia i daje nowe możliwości tworzenia komponentowych aplikacji webowych.

Podczas warsztatów poznasz ideę tworzenia aplikacji webowych z wykorzystaniem komponentów Polymer, poznasz praktyczne zastosowanie popularnych komponentów, dowiesz się jak stworzyć własny komponent i pochwalić się nim światu. Weźmiesz też udział we wspólnym tworzeniu nowoczesnej aplikacji dla uczestników konferencji.

tutors.name: Michał Suchecki
tutors.bio_in_md: Od 10 lat pracuję w @javeo_eu jako fullstack developer, obecnie w randze architekta. W bio wszyscy piszą jakie technologie lubią - ja lubię jak oprogramowanie działa a satysfakcję zawodową osiągam widząc uśmiech na twarzach pań Halinek z księgowości.

tutors.name: Daniel Chruściak
tutors.bio_in_md: Software Developer with over 10 years experience. Currently Team Leader in Javeo where he builds next-generation applications. The enthusiast of Scala and functional programming, also follower of simplicity and clean code.

tutors.name: Bartosz Bąbol
tutors.bio_in_md: Software engineer in Javeo, programming enthusiast,  particularly interested in functional and reactive programming.

title: Data marketing
descriptionInMd:
Munging and analyzing data is loads of fun, especially when you communicate with people who understand you - quants, researchers, analysts, programmers. But usually they are not the decision makers. And when it comes to selling data, nobody will care about your beautiful analyses and visualizations, they will most probably want just one number.

The workshop is about choosing the first right number (the one that is demanded from you) and selling other ideas (the ones they should demand) to decision makers. It's based on WHO-approach of evidence briefs for policy and my two-years experience as a quant in public administration.

tutors.name: Alicja Raszkowska
tutors.bio_in_md: Alicja has been exploring data science since 2008. An incurable optimist, she has been working in the Polish public sector as an analyst-turned-technology-translator. She tends to munge and wrangle data until it shows the right, yet not necessarily the expected outcomes, constantly emphasizing the difference between the two to decision-makers. In her free time she enjoys board games and learning languages.

title: Reactive Programming on Android
descriptionInMd:
During this workshop we will demonstrate API and techniques which can be applied to develop a reactive application for highly concurrent Android Environment. This workshop will not be focused on the Reactive Manifesto academic aspects, but on how to apply the concepts in real life application. Beginning with standard Android SDK, moving to 3rd party libraries, we will explore various methods of asynchronous computation based on event communication. This will allow you to learn the pros and cons of various approaches to develop Android apps. Instead of going deep into technical aspects how those mechanisms work, we will present how to use those APIs.

Within the scope we will develop an application using Android Rx, different methods to implement event bus pattern. To create more concise code we will employ Retrolambda plugin.

The attendee for this workshop should have basic knowledge of Android platform.

Requirements:

 - Bring your laptop with stable release of Android Studio.

 - Mobile device with Android operating system.

 - USB cable to connect device to your machine.

 - Installed Java SDK version 7 and 8.

tutors.name: Damian Leszczyński
tutors.tagline: Solutions Architect/Developer @ Samsung R&D Institute Poland
tutors.bio_in_md: Damian Leszczyński works as Solutions Architect / Developer for Samsung Business. Currently his daily basis is to bring value on mobile devices to business customer. Before this opportunity he was responsible for architecture analysis provided to development teams. Enforcing the clean, decoupled and sustainable design, for open and complex production realities. All this would not have been possible without the dedication of several years of work on the ERP system for international production company, his passion to Software Engineering, JVM environment, lean methodologies and surround community of people willing to introduce change.

tutors.name: Paweł Ptaszyński
tutors.tagline: Software Engineer @ Samsung R&D Institute Poland
tutors.bio_in_md: Solution Architect and Developer working on new B2B solutions based on mobile devices powered by Android platform. He has been working in various roles covering full software development lifecycle - as analyst, developer, tester, dev team leader or even software process engineer, but has always been enthusiast of code. Part time agile evangelist and a fan of great dev tools. Recently passionate about Scala, reactive design & programming and PaaS solutions.

title: The hands-on introduction to probabilistic programming in Figaro
descriptionInMd: During workshop the fundamentals of probabilistic programming will be explained. Probabilistic programming has a considerable chance to democratize machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence among non programmers and spread ML techniques across many disciplines and industries, and thus be the next big thing in data science. The concepts of probabilistic programming are to be demonstrated in Figaro, Scala library. A selected examples leading step by step to a nontrivial probabilistic programming system will be done during the workshop. The knowledge of Scala is advised but not strictly required (although in this case the knowledge of any modern programming language (c++, java, python, haskell,..) is strongly recommended in order to follow and comprehend the material). Functional nature of Scala is also to be embraced in the last parts of the workshop. The participants are asked to bring laptops with themselves. More details about the final setup are to be available later. The workshop is to be held in English.

tutors.name: Paweł Jakubas
tutors.tagline: Software Engineer @ Samsung R&D Institute Poland
tutors.bio_in_md: Pawel Jakubas is a software engineer interested in full stack development, big data and data science. He works with a number of technologies, eg., scala, hadoop, spark, aws, mesos, mongodb, angularJS.. . He is passionate about harnessing distributed systems in the context of big data analytics. He holds MSc in finance and banking, MSc Eng in mechatronics, and PhD in physics. He can be contacted via: jakubas dot pawel at gmail dot com.

title: Wykorzystaj serwisy Azure i skup się na tym, co ważne.
descriptionInMd: W trakcie krótkiego warsztatu pokażę, jak wykorzystać usługi poziomu Platform as a Service dostępne na Microsoft Azure, aby skrócić czas dostarczenia systemu na rynek, oraz zminimalizować ogólne koszty związane z utrzymaniem tzw "produkcji". Wyjaśnię, jak dzięki dobremu wykorzystaniu narzędzi możemy skoncentrować się na tym, co tworzymy i zepchnąć problem deploymentu na drugi plan.

tutors.name: Krzysztof Szabelski
tutors.bio_in_md: Na co dzień doradca i konsultant techniczny w gliwickiej firmie Future Processing. Zajmuje się przede wszystkim architekturą systemów, optymalizowaniem procesów wytwarzania oprogramowania i programowaniem w C#. Zawsze jednak stara się wychodzić daleko poza świat technologii Microsoft, aby czerpać inspirację i poszerzać swoją wiedzę. Prywatnie motocyklista, skialpinista i pasjonat wszelkich sportów ekstremalnych.

title: Tasting Typography: Make Your Own Letters
descriptionInMd: Have you ever wondered why there are so many different fonts? Where did they come from? What differentiates them? Are you able to design your own letters? Come to our workshop to try your hand at lettering craftsmanship.

tutors.name: Gosia Dzierżewicz
tutors.bio_in_md: Gosia Dzierżewicz is a UI Designer at Polidea. During her studies at the Design Faculty of the Academy of Fine Arts in Warsaw she focused on graphic design. That’s why Gosia sees typography as a powerful tool for effective visual communication and uses its principles to create clear and understandable interfaces. She also runs the Design Practice Meetup and is one of the organisers of MCE Conferences.

tutors.name: Magda Zadara
tutors.bio_in_md: Magda Zadara studied product design at Central Saint Martins and the Academy of Fine Arts in Warsaw and decided to mix her passion for technology with the traditional craft she learned to work on digital products. Currently, she works as a UI Designer at Polidea, where she’s part of developer-designer teams who create mobile apps. She also runs the Design Practice Meetup and is one of the organisers of MCE Conferences.

title: Software Defined Networking and OpenStack
descriptionInMd:
Deep dive into Software Defined Networking (SDN) and Cloud.

First we will remind some networking concepts and introduce SDN.

You will write own SDN controller in POX/Ryu.

Then we will get OpenStack Networking insight, to finally explore how SDN can be used for OpenStack.

Some minimum knowledge of IP networks is needed. Most of coding will be done in Python.

tutors.name: Konrad Gawda
tutors.bio_in_md: Telecommunications specialist, born in Vienna, graduated Warsaw University of Technology. Working with lab evaluation of new technologies and preparing prototypes of innovative telco solutions. Also - Python programmer and hobby electronics developer.

tutors.name: Michał Muszalski
tutors.bio_in_md: Telecommunications specialist, graduated from Warsaw University of Technology. Working with new telco solutions: preparing prototypes and concepts of the innovative solutions. Python developer concerned in network and application security. Personally interested in photography, electronics and gliding.

tutors.name: Michał Pawłowski
tutors.bio_in_md: Graduated from Warsaw University of Technology, telecommunication network engineer. Main area of work includes programmable networks (SDN) and network function virtualization (NFV).

title: Make it smooth and easy - frontend application with Ember CLI
descriptionInMd: Move your programming life to the next level of simplicity with Ember CLI. The command line tool for creating ambitious web applications. At our workshop we will check, how much fun brings using this simple solution with creating more or less complicated web applications.

tutors.name: Katarzyna Jastrzębska
tutors.bio_in_md: I believe that passion for work is the key to do something better and better. Frontend development is my passion, this is something I want to improve not only when I'm working, but all the time.  Sight is the most important human sense and my goal is to give user the best experience with applications I'm preparing.  At the moment I'm improving my design and Adobe Illustrator Skills, I love to work with JavaScript and every variation of this language.
